# Copilot Instructions

## Repository Overview

This is the NewRepository - a general-purpose repository for development projects.

## Development Guidelines

### Code Style and Standards

- Write clean, readable, and maintainable code
- Follow language-specific best practices and conventions
- Use meaningful variable and function names
- Include comments for complex logic
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility

### Documentation

- Update the README.md when adding new features or making significant changes
- Document public APIs and interfaces
- Include usage examples where appropriate
- Keep documentation up-to-date with code changes

### Git Practices

- Write clear, descriptive commit messages
- Keep commits atomic and focused on a single change
- Use meaningful branch names
- Review changes before committing

### Testing

- Write tests for new features and bug fixes
- Ensure tests are passing before committing
- Follow existing testing patterns in the repository
- Aim for good test coverage of critical functionality

### Security

- Never commit sensitive information (API keys, passwords, tokens)
- Follow security best practices for the specific language/framework
- Validate and sanitize user inputs
- Keep dependencies up-to-date

## Project-Specific Notes

- This repository is in early stages of development
- Check for existing patterns and follow them when adding new code
- Coordinate with team members for architectural decisions
